Created an attachment (id=40920)
patch

This patch implements the handle to element conversion in a more fault-tolerant way. Working copy owner takes precedence, if no element has been found, the primary one is used
patch makes sense. should fix in RC4 as this is a reopened bug.

I still have some questions about the patch. I suggest we look at this tomorrow when Tobias is back.

Darin and Philippe, do you in principle agree that we should fix this bug as it seems that the fix for RC3 introduced this problem?

I agree on the principle, as a regression got introduced.
+1 for 3.2RC4
+1 on principle.

Created an attachment (id=41299)
patch to create working copy before resolving arguments

This patch tries to resolve the element handle using the private working copy owner. If the handle does not exist, a working copy for the element is lazily created.

Reviewed and tested patch. +1 for 3.2 RC4 as this is a regression from RC3.

The patch in comment 7 started to use JavaCore.create(handle, workingCopyOwner) but forgot to create the working copy of the input element first.

Markus, can you also review and test?
Darin and Philippe, please veto if your +1 are not valid anymore.
+1, regression should be addressed.

Created an attachment (id=41319)
patch with more checks

adds additional 'exists()' and 'not null' checks
Martin's patch with more checks (comment 22) looks good. It avoids an NPE when Bicycle does not exist in the second workspace, and triggers the noraml handling of fatal errors during initialization.
patch released for RC4
verified in I20060512-1600
